Posts.Content: Jan2014 wrote: My worries started at the beginning of July when I noticed nipple discharge from my right breast.  The first few days, I blamed it on sweat as the weather was so hot and humid, then I thought it could be my body lotion.  I think I was just looking for any excuses as this was only happening on one side.  At that point, I was always wearing colored bras so I couldn't tell what color it was.  Then I wore a white one and got really scared when I seen it was yellowish/green.  Let me tell you that's when Google became my best friend or maybe my worse enemy.  Some things I was reading made me worried and then some made me feel more at ease.  After a week, I decided to call my doctor's nurse as the discharge was still happening and I wanted her opinion.  She made me an appointment that very afternoon to a resident doctor.  She did consult the doctor who was on call and she requested a mammogram and an ultrasound and made me another appointment to see her and my family doctor in 2 weeks time.  I went for my appointments the day before my schedule doctor's appointment.  When I saw my family doctor and his resident, they had only received the results of the ultrasound.  It said that it showed a dilated milk duct of approximately 3mm.  They reassured me that it happens a lot in women my age, 48, and it's probably nothing to worry about but because they are not breast specialist they were sending me to a breast clinic where I was to see a surgeon.  It took a little more than 3 weeks to get my next appointment.  She had received the results of my mammo and it showed a cyst on my left breast and the radiologist was requesting an ultrasound on it. I should say that I have fibrocystic breasts.  She proceeded to check my right breast and because the discharge was spontaneous and only from one milk duct she requested a galactography.  Two weeks later I went for both tests and returned to the specialist the week after for results.  She said that the ultrasound showed a 2.2cm cyst on my left breast and that she would repeat the ultrasound in 6 months.  The galacto on my right breast showed a tumor in my milk duct which she said was probably a papilloma.  She said that she would perform surgery to remove it.  She also said that I shouldn't worry that it was 90 to 95% not cancer.  I had my surgery almost 2 weeks ago and I see her again next week for the results.  It's safe to say that I've been worried a lot.  It's like there's a black cloud following me since the beginning of July.  The waiting is just too long...  Has anyone every had similar experiences?  I'm sorry now that I didn't ask more questions.  She is not forth coming with details.  I have no clue why she wants to do another ultrasound in March for the cyst.  I will ask her that next week.  Right now, I'm worried more about the results of the biopsy...
